text: William Joseph Bell (March 6, 1927 â€“ April 29, 2005) was an American screenwriter and television producer. He was best known as the creator of the soap operas Another World, The Young and the Restless and The Bold and the Beautiful. Bell was born and raised in Chicago. On April 29, 2005, Bell died at age 78 from complications of Alzheimer's disease. He is buried at Westwood Memorial Park Cemetery in Los Angeles. == References == == Other websites == * Category:1927 births Category:2005 deaths Category:American television producers Category:Screenwriters from Chicago Category:American Emmy Award winners Category:Deaths from Alzheimer's disease Category:Disease-related deaths in Los Angeles Category:University of Michigan alumni
title: William J. Bell
